match.title: 5th ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 6 wickets (with 10 balls remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of England and Ireland
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of England and Ireland

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c †Sangakkara b Senanayake 56 (85b 3x4 0x6 118m) SR: 65.88

dismissalComment.html: goes to paddle sweep but like Root it's popped a catch up to Sangakkara and that completes a real grind from Cook since passing fifty, slowed right down. Trying to tuck it around the corner, it took a decent top edge and looped up behind the keeper who spun 180 degrees, took two steps forward and claimed the easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c & b Mendis 37 (42b 3x4 0x6 59m) SR: 88.09

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! What a mixture from Mendis (and Bell). The batsman can barely believe it. Pops a dolly of a return catch to Mendis as the ball, just short of a length, stopped in the pitch which meant Bell played too early.

and he strikes first ball! Length outside off stump, Ballance went to play it into the covers but, like Bell's dismissal, it totally stopped in the wicket and Ballance popped a catch back to the bowler. Another bonus for Sri Lanka, a pretty ordinary delivery getting stuck in the wicket
cleaned up! Full and straight, Tredwell misses trying to drive through the off side
all over! A slower ball completely defeats Anderson as he hoicks to leg. Hits the off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! What a mixture from Mendis (and Bell). The batsman can barely believe it. Pops a dolly of a return catch to Mendis as the ball, just short of a length, stopped in the pitch which meant Bell played too early.

another horror show for England! Bopara goes to pull a short ball, which he completely misses and gets bowled between his legs as the ball dips slightly under the shot. Credit to Mendis as well, though, as it was delivered slower

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c & b Mendis 37 (42b 3x4 0x6 59m) SR: 88.09

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! What a mixture from Mendis (and Bell). The batsman can barely believe it. Pops a dolly of a return catch to Mendis as the ball, just short of a length, stopped in the pitch which meant Bell played too early.

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Ballance c & b Malinga 10 (15b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes first ball! Length outside off stump, Ballance went to play it into the covers but, like Bell's dismissal, it totally stopped in the wicket and Ballance popped a catch back to the bowler. Another bonus for Sri Lanka, a pretty ordinary delivery getting stuck in the wicket

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root c †Sangakkara b Priyanjan 10 (11b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: full, Root goes to reverse sweep and misses, there's two cries, one for lbw and then, when the ball popped up to Sangakkara, for a catch behind. Not out given on both counts but they go for the review and it looks straight off the glove. Yep smack bang off the glove, straight up and Sangakkara takes the catch walking a yard in front of the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c †Sangakkara b Senanayake 56 (85b 3x4 0x6 118m) SR: 65.88

dismissalComment.html: goes to paddle sweep but like Root it's popped a catch up to Sangakkara and that completes a real grind from Cook since passing fifty, slowed right down. Trying to tuck it around the corner, it took a decent top edge and looped up behind the keeper who spun 180 degrees, took two steps forward and claimed the easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Jayawardene b Mathews 17 (27b 0x4 1x6 26m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, Morgan tries to help it around the corner but gets a top edge and it carries all the way to deep backward sqaure. That's a very bad wicket for England to lose. Morgan got it slightly wrong and that was dangerous the way he tried to play it, had he tried to whack into Harborne it may well have gone for six

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara b Mendis 17 (30b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 56.66

dismissalComment.html: another horror show for England! Bopara goes to pull a short ball, which he completely misses and gets bowled between his legs as the ball dips slightly under the shot. Credit to Mendis as well, though, as it was delivered slower

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler run out (Senanayake) 21 (24b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: drifts onto the pads, clipped away fine and this pair are very rapid between the wickets

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell b Malinga 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: cleaned up! Full and straight, Tredwell misses trying to drive through the off side

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan run out (Perera/Mendis) 30 (42b 3x4 0x6 44m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: nine down! A awful mix-up. Jordan nudged to the leg side. Not sure there was ever a single but Anderson kept on running and Jordan had no chance in the end

dismissalText.commentary: James Anderson b Malinga 5 (7b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: all over! A slower ball completely defeats Anderson as he hoicks to leg. Hits the off stump.

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne not out 60 (101b 2x4 1x6 154m) SR: 59.4
Mahela Jayawardene c Anderson b Jordan 53 (90b 4x4 0x6 110m) SR: 58.88

dismissalComment.html: full length and Jayawardene goes to drive down the ground and gets it all wrong, putting it high into the sky and straight to mid-off. Extraordinary stroke, he was in complete control put didn't time this at all, sending it high and Anderson didn't have to move to take a straightforward catch. Perhaps didn't quite come onto the bat as Jayawardene would have liked

a skip down the wicket, slapped into the off side but in the air and Root dives to catch at cover a fine flying take to his right-hand side and England get a much-needed wicket. Dilshan didn't get the elevation on the stroke and it was an excellent catch from Root

floated up, sharp turn squares Sangakkara up takes a thick edge that's taken by Jordan with an outstanding leap to his left, outstanding take because that went sharply off the edge but it was the sharp turn that did for Sangakkara, it pitched on about middle and leg and ragged right across the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: full at the stumps, huge cry for lbw and given him out! Perera goes for the review almost immediately but there's nothing on Hot Spot nor on Real Time Snicko. Height could save Perera here but no, Hawk Eye has the delivery taking a good smack of the top of off stump, far more than "umpire's call" might suggest. Classic full inswing from Anderson and England are moving here

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Root b Tredwell 28 (23b 5x4 0x6 33m) SR: 121.73

dismissalComment.html: a skip down the wicket, slapped into the off side but in the air and Root dives to catch at cover a fine flying take to his right-hand side and England get a much-needed wicket. Dilshan didn't get the elevation on the stroke and it was an excellent catch from Root

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Jordan b Tredwell 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: floated up, sharp turn squares Sangakkara up takes a thick edge that's taken by Jordan with an outstanding leap to his left, outstanding take because that went sharply off the edge but it was the sharp turn that did for Sangakkara, it pitched on about middle and leg and ragged right across the stumps

headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera lbw b Anderson 19 (29b 2x4 0x6 48m) SR: 65.51

dismissalComment.html: full at the stumps, huge cry for lbw and given him out! Perera goes for the review almost immediately but there's nothing on Hot Spot nor on Real Time Snicko. Height could save Perera here but no, Hawk Eye has the delivery taking a good smack of the top of off stump, far more than "umpire's call" might suggest. Classic full inswing from Anderson and England are moving here

Extraordinary stroke, he was in complete control put didn't time this at all, sending it high and Anderson didn't have to move to take a straightforward catch. Perhaps didn't quite come onto the bat as Jayawardene would have liked

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: now this is short outside off and slapped past short third man

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all she wrote for this one-day series, Sri Lanka the winniners 3-2 in what has been really a pretty exciting series with batting collapses galore followed by two pretty tight matches. But now we turn to the real stuff with the Test matches to come at Lord's and Headingley, the first at HQ on June 12. England's eagerly anticipated squad is set to be announced on Thursday, so look out for that, and we'll see you for the Test matches, bye for now...

Presentation time, with some interesting issues to deal with for the captains. Here's Alastair Cook: "We were 20 or 30 short. On that wicket, it turned a bit and was quite slow which suited them. It dewed up a bit and came on a bit at the end which was okay to chase. We got off to a good start, everyone got 20s and 30s. The Buttler dismissal, I think you're going to ask Angelo why he did it, I was disappointed with it. You don't know in the spur of the moment what you would do but you hope you wouldn't do it. There were some good things about the series and some progress made - Chris Jordan and Harry Gurney - but still plenty of areas to work on with 20 games until the World Cup."

The winning captain is Angelo Mathews: "After 2006 it's a great moment for us, it's a great achievement for the team. It started of pretty slowly but our bowlers did a brilliant job to pull them back to 220. Buttler was taking unfair starts so we gave him two warnings and after that I didn't know what to do to stop him from doing it. It's within the rules and in the spirit of cricket we gave him chances in this game and the last game."
Man of the Match is the Sri Lanka vice-captain Lahiru Thirimanne for his excellent half-century which helped Sri Lanka home very comfortably in the end.
Man of the Series is Lasith Malinga for his excellence with the ball at the start of the innings and especially at the death.

Once again it's been nice to have a close match, this wasn't quite the thriller of Saturday but a contest that had some edge after the Makadding earlier on - more on that to come I'm sure. England were set on making Sri Lanka pay with three quick wickets but missed their chance to dismiss Mahela Jayawardene, he made a steady half-century and added almost a hundred with vice-captain Lahiru Thirimanne, who went on to make his own fifty to steer the chase. Just when it was getting close, Angelo Mathews chanced his arm to good effect and the tourists go over the line to come back from 2-1 down to take the series.

Sri Lanka get home pretty comfortably in the end and win by six wickets to take the series 3-2. They've been the better side here, restricted England in the middle overs, bowled them out for a total just below par and then recovered nicely with a strong partnership in the chase and found a kick when they needed it to get over the line with 10 balls to spare.

commentPreTextItems.html: Mathews has played a lovely hand here, acceleration at the right time to just push Sri Lanka along here, ridden his luck but fortune favours the brave and now Sri Lanka just need one hit, can Mathews provide it? Bopara to bowl...

commentTextItems.html: absolute dirt from Bopara, back of a length sliding on the leg side and it's easily turned around the corner backward of square
firm drive to just wide of mid-off for a sharp single

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

commentTextItems.html: short and slapped hard down to third man but it's wide of the fielder for a once-bounce four, once again, Mathews get the run of the ball with that just evading the fielder
down the wicket this time but again Thirimanne manages to find third man, this time reaching for a drive and opening the face
step to leg, Jordan follows him, Mathews able to angle it down to third man
yorker just outside off but again Thirimanne manages to dig it out down to third man

commentPreTextItems.html: It needs something Malinga-esque now, can Jordan provide it...

commentTextItems.html: short of a length, tucked around the corner for a single to long leg
excellent yorker, dug out back to the bowler

commentPostTextItems.html: Excellent over from Anderson who has just brought England back into it slightly, another fine set from Anderson...

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full on the stumps, driven in the air back to the bowler and dropped he got a solid right hand to it at shoulder height but couldn't cling on, tough chance but England needed that
cracking drive with Anderson offering width but Root makes a handy save at cover point
full on the off stump, pushed up back to the bowler
length ball just blocked in the crease

commentPreTextItems.html: Anderson back for his last over, England need something special here...

commentTextItems.html: back of a length, slower ball, and Thirimanne back quickly, picks the delivery, and lifts it over midwicket, a controlled stroke and it's well timed enough to go for four
over the wicket, full length, driven back on the bounce to the bowler

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a step to leg and cracked over cover, powerfully struck and the power of Mathews evident again

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka closing in now with those two fours...

commentTextItems.html: full on off stump, played forward back to the bowler
down the track and goes for the big shot again and this time nails it over mid-on, clubbed for a one bounce four, just what the tourists needed
whatdoyaknow, Thirimanne sits in the crease and uses the pace to take a single to third man
around the wicket, low full toss, clipped out to deep midwicket but just a single

dismissalComment.html: goes to paddle sweep but like Root it's popped a catch up to Sangakkara and that completes a real grind from Cook since passing fifty, slowed right down. Trying to tuck it around the corner, it took a decent top edge and looped up behind the keeper who spun 180 degrees, took two steps forward and claimed the easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Jayawardene b Mathews 17 (27b 0x4 1x6 26m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, Morgan tries to help it around the corner but gets a top edge and it carries all the way to deep backward sqaure. That's a very bad wicket for England to lose. Morgan got it slightly wrong and that was dangerous the way he tried to play it, had he tried to whack into Harborne it may well have gone for six

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara b Mendis 17 (30b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 56.66

dismissalComment.html: another horror show for England! Bopara goes to pull a short ball, which he completely misses and gets bowled between his legs as the ball dips slightly under the shot. Credit to Mendis as well, though, as it was delivered slower

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler run out (Senanayake) 21 (24b 1x4 0x6 53m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: drifts onto the pads, clipped away fine and this pair are very rapid between the wickets

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell b Malinga 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: cleaned up! Full and straight, Tredwell misses trying to drive through the off side

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan run out (Perera/Mendis) 30 (42b 3x4 0x6 44m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: nine down! A awful mix-up. Jordan nudged to the leg side. Not sure there was ever a single but Anderson kept on running and Jordan had no chance in the end

dismissalText.commentary: James Anderson b Malinga 5 (7b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: all over! A slower ball completely defeats Anderson as he hoicks to leg. Hits the off stump.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Root b Tredwell 28 (23b 5x4 0x6 33m) SR: 121.73

dismissalComment.html: a skip down the wicket, slapped into the off side but in the air and Root dives to catch at cover a fine flying take to his right-hand side and England get a much-needed wicket. Dilshan didn't get the elevation on the stroke and it was an excellent catch from Root

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera lbw b Anderson 19 (29b 2x4 0x6 48m) SR: 65.51

dismissalComment.html: full at the stumps, huge cry for lbw and given him out! Perera goes for the review almost immediately but there's nothing on Hot Spot nor on Real Time Snicko. Height could save Perera here but no, Hawk Eye has the delivery taking a good smack of the top of off stump, far more than "umpire's call" might suggest. Classic full inswing from Anderson and England are moving here

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Jordan b Tredwell 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: floated up, sharp turn squares Sangakkara up takes a thick edge that's taken by Jordan with an outstanding leap to his left, outstanding take because that went sharply off the edge but it was the sharp turn that did for Sangakkara, it pitched on about middle and leg and ragged right across the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Anderson b Jordan 53 (90b 4x4 0x6 110m) SR: 58.88

dismissalComment.html: full length and Jayawardene goes to drive down the ground and gets it all wrong, putting it high into the sky and straight to mid-off. Extraordinary stroke, he was in complete control put didn't time this at all, sending it high and Anderson didn't have to move to take a straightforward catch. Perhaps didn't quite come onto the bat as Jayawardene would have liked

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne not out 60 (101b 2x4 1x6 154m) SR: 59.4

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 42 (34b 6x4 0x6 49m) SR: 123.52

milestones.description: Ian Bell has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ENG breaking Pietersen's record

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.subTitle: 5th ODI, Birmingham

stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fifth ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014

stories.title: Fine-tuning for Sri Lanka to peak at World Cup
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Fine-tuning for Sri Lanka to peak at World Cup
stories.summary: Sri Lanka have the batting raw materials to launch a fine World Cup campaign but a little polishing may make a considerable difference in eight months' time

image.caption: Mahela Jayawardene rebuilt Sri Lanka after quick wickets fell
image.longCaption: Mahela Jayawardene rebuilt Sri Lanka after quick wickets fell, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: England must confront failings to improve
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: England must confront failings to improve
stories.summary: There were some admirable aspects to England's cricket in this series but they are going to need to rethink their tactics for the World Cup

image.caption: Alastair Cook had to work hard for his runs
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook had to work hard for his runs, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: Emboldened Sri Lanka keep their cool
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Emboldened Sri Lanka keep their cool
stories.summary: It may have been tempting for Sri Lanka to hide Sachithra Senanayake in this match, in hope the furore would blow over. But emboldened by the added pressure instead, they made his role in the match more prominent

image.caption: Angelo Mathews celebrates the winning runs
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews celebrates the winning runs, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: Jayawardene defends Buttler Mankading
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Mahela Jayawardene defends Jos Buttler Mankading
stories.summary: Mahela Jayawardene has defended the Sri Lanka team after England's captain, Alastair Cook, suggested "a line had been crossed" in the deciding ODI of the series between England and Sri Lanka

image.caption: Alastair Cook was not happy at the end of the match
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook was not happy at the end of the match, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: Jayawardene finds the gap
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Plays of the day: Mahela Jayawardene finds the gap
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the fifth and final one-day international between England and Sri Lanka

image.caption: Chris Jordan caught Kumar Sangakkara at slip
image.longCaption: Chris Jordan caught Kumar Sangakkara at slip, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: Senanayake catches Buttler dozing
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: George Dobell: Sachithra Senanayake catches Jos Buttler dozing
stories.summary: Jos Buttler should have known better when Sachithra Senanayake warned him about backing up too far - the bowler does not deserve criticism for 'Mankading'

image.caption: Michael Gough has no choice but to uphold Sachithra Senanayake's appeal
image.longCaption: Michael Gough has no choice but to uphold Sachithra Senanayake's appeal, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: SL claim series amid Senanayake controversy
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka claim series amid Sachithra Senanayake controversy
stories.summary: Figures of 1 for 36 were just one thread of Sri Lanka's series-clinching six-wicket win but, by running out Jos Buttler while the batsman was backing up, Sachithra Senanayake ensured that the narrative would be wound around him

image.caption: Sachithra Senanayake carried on regardless having been reported for throwing at Lord's
image.longCaption: Sachithra Senanayake carried on regardless having been reported for throwing at Lord's, England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston, June 3, 2014

stories.title: England face test of priorities
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Edgbaston
stories.seoTitle: George Dobell: England face test of priorities
stories.summary: If England do win the ODI series against Sri Lanka, it may only serve to mask some of the issues they must resolve ahead of the World Cup

image.caption: It has been an up and down start for Peter Moores in his second stint as England coach
image.longCaption: It has been an up and down start for Peter Moores in his second stint as England coach, Edgbaston, June 2, 2014
